title: Abomination of Gudul
description: Whenever Abomination of Gudul deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

pre-consent.title: Pre Consent Form
pre-consent.body: Do you agree to begin the experiment?

prompts.title: Remove distractions
prompts.text: Our patented underground bunkers will let you work productively, even in the event of nuclear war. (batteries not included)

prompts.title: Need to run?
prompts.text: In case of attack by lizard people, press F1 to exit the experiment and choose privacy settings for your video. (helpful if the lizard people don't consent to be recorded)

maybe-consent.title: Just checking
maybe-consent.body: Are you sure you know what you're getting into?
maybe-consent.consentLabel: I was told there were cookies

prompts.title: A horse is a horse
prompts.text: But please don't say that backwards.

maybe-consent2.title: But seriously. Are you SURE?
maybe-consent2.body: It's possible you didn't get the last consent form, so we will try to ask again
maybe-consent2.consentLabel: If it's good enough for the IRB, it's good enough for me

prompts.title: Hello, world!
prompts.text: You can generate a sound file on your mac by typing say 'Hello, world' -o ~/Desktop/test_assets/helloworld.mp4 --file-format mp4f

post-consent.title: Final Notice of Consent
post-consent.body: Do you agree to finish the experiment?
post-consent.consentLabel: I am disinclined to the reverse negation of the decision to not cease the termination of the test

title: Absolver Thrull
description: When Absolver Thrull enters the battlefield or the creature it haunts dies, destroy target enchantment.

exit-survey.title: Post-study Survey
exit-survey.exitThankYou: Thanks so much! We appreciate every family's help. No matter how your child responded, we can learn something from his or her behavior--for instance, if he or she got bored and decided to stop, we know we need to make studies that are more fun!
exit-survey.exitMessage: Every session helps us learn about your child's growing brain. We look forward to seeing your family again! You can complete your next "Physics" session as soon as tomorrow.

title: Barbarian Bully
description: Discard a card at random: Barbarian Bully gets +2/+2 until end of turn unless a player has Barbarian Bully deal 4 damage to him or her. Activate this ability only once each turn.

video-config.title: Pre Video Consent Form
video-config.body: Do you agree to begin the experiment?

video-consent.title: Pre Video Consent Form
video-consent.body: Do you agree to begin the experiment?

title: Carnivorous Death-Parrot
description: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Carnivorous Death-Parrot unless you say its flavor text.

title: Withengar Unbound
description: Flying, intimidate, trample (A creature with intimidate can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.) Whenever a player loses the game, put thirteen +1/+1 counters on Withengar Unbound.

title: Worldspine Wurm
description: When Worldspine Wurm dies, put three 5/5 green Wurm creature tokens with trample onto the battlefield. When Worldspine Wurm is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

title: Deadly Grub
description: Vanishing 3 (This permanent enters the battlefield with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.) When Deadly Grub dies, if it had no time counters on it, put a 6/1 green Insect creature token with shroud onto the battlefield. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

title: Faerie Mechanist
description: When Faerie Mechanist enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

title: Centaur Rootcaster
description: Whenever Centaur Rootcaster deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

overview.title: Learning from Others: overview
overview.whatHappens: First your child will see two actors naming familiar objects. Sometimes they're correct, sometimes they're not. Then we'll show the same actors naming unfamiliar objects and ask your child some questions about which answers he or she trusts.
overview.purpose: How children track and use information about reliability.
overview.captionLeft: The 'Familiar object' videos look like this. Two actors will be introduced and asked to name various familar objects, like a brush or rubber duck. Usually, one is more accurate that the other.
overview.captionRight: The 'Novel object' videos look like this. The same two actors will name new, funny-looking objects with nonsense words.
overview.summary: Your child will be asked what he or she thinks each object is called. Once your child response, please repeat his or her answer, but try not to either confirm or correct the answer. For instance, if your child said that the funny-looking object was a blicket, you'd just say "Okay, a blicket!" (Sometimes we have trouble hearing or understanding what kids are saying, and parents are their best interpreters.)
